New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 109 points over a two-game span, the most in franchise history, passing DeMarcus Cousins
Key Match Events: The Kings trailed 89-78 in the third quarter but came back in the fourth to take a 118-116 lead on a Jordan McLaughlin 3-pointer with a minute left to play
De'Aaron Fox made his first seven shots from the floor, including three 3-pointers in the first quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings made 19 of 41 shots (46.3%) from 3-point range
De'Aaron Fox talks about a unique play where he stomp his shoe mid-play
The Kings host the Atlanta Hawks on Monday, while the Jazz continue their five-game trip against the Los Angeles Clippers on Sunday
Others: Taylor Hendricks and Walker Kessler did not play for the Jazz due to injury
DeMar DeRozan, Malik Monk, and Domantas Sabonis were sidelined for Sacramento
